Top 3 Tekno Berita Hari Ini: Bos Smartisan dan Drone Tempur Rusia
04 Nov 2019, 11:36 by Moh Khory Alfarizi, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Top 3 Tekno berita hari ini dimulai dari topik tentang pendiri pabrik ponsel Smartisan di Cina, dilarang naik kereta cepat dan pesawat di negaranya sendiri karena perusahaannya tidak mematuhi keputusan pengadilan untuk masalah kontrak.
Berita terpopuler lain adalah pesawat nirawak atau drone tempur Rusia, Orion telah menyelesaikan uji coba pertempuran di Suriah dan sekarang mulai melengkapi sejumlah unit untuk pengujian lebih lanjut, demikian dikutip National Interest, 1 November 2019.
Berita lain tentang tips teknologi yang mengulas bagaimana melindungi data pribadi dari ancaman peretas yang memanfaatkan Pegasus Spyware.
Berikut tiga berita terpopuler di kanal Tekno:
1. Tak Bayar Hutang, Pendiri Pabrik Ponsel Cina Dilarang Hidup Mewah
Pendiri perusahaan ponsel merek Smartisan di Cina, dilarang naik kereta cepat dan pesawat di negaranya sendiri karena perusahaannya tidak mematuhi keputusan pengadilan untuk masalah kontrak.
Pendiri Smartisan, Luo Yonghao, juga dilarang untuk bermalam di hotel mewah, bersenang-senang di klub malam mewah, klub golf, membeli properti, ikut asuransi premium dan menyekolahkan anak di sekolah swasta yang mahal, berdasarkan perintah dari pengadilan Danyang di Cina bagian selatan, dikutip dari Reuters.
Pengadilan mengeluarkan perintah tersebut karena Smartisan gagal memenuhi keputusan pengadilan terkait perselisihan kontrak dengan perusahaan elektronik setempat.
2. Drone Tempur Rusia Orion Diuji Coba dalam Perang di Suriah
Pesawat nirawak atau drone milik Rusia, Orion telah menyelesaikan uji coba pertempuran di Suriah dan sekarang mulai melengkapi sejumlah unit untuk pengujian lebih lanjut, demikian dikutip National Interest, 1 November 2019.
Orion merupakan senjata yang dikendalikan oleh satelit, produk dari Grup Kronshtadt. Drone ini mirip dengan pesawat predator milik Angkatan Udara AS Reaper, yang pensiun pada 2017 setelah digunakan selama lebih dari 20 tahun.
"Drone Orion dalam konfigurasi serangannya dapat membawa hingga empat rudal, yang berhasil diuji-coba di Suriah," kata sumber anonim kepada kantor berita Rusia TASS. "Drone mulai digunakan pasukan Rusia untuk evaluasi operasionalnya, setelah itu komando akan membuat keputusan produksi."
3. Tips Teknologi: Lindungi Data Privasi dari Pegasus Spyware
Tips teknologi kali ini Tempo mengulas bagaimana melindungi data pribadi dari ancaman peretas yang memanfaatkan Pegasus Spyware.
Dalam waktu sepekan, dua kasus pencurian data terungkap. Pertama, adalah penjualan rincian kartu debit dan kredit India di web gelap. Kedua, adalah penggunaan Pegasus Spyware untuk memata-matai aktivis hak asasi manusia dan jurnalis.
Selain tiga berita terpopuler di atas, Anda bisa membaca berita hari ini seputar sains dan teknologi hanya di kanal Tekno Tempo.co.

Top 3 Tekno News Today: Smartisan Boss and Russian Combat Drone
04 Nov 2019, 11:36 by Moh Khory Alfarizi, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Today's Top 3 Techno news begins with the topic of the founder of the Smartisan cellphone factory in China, banned from taking a fast train and airplane in his own country because his company did not comply with a court decision on contractual matters.
Another popular news is the Russian drone or drone, Orion has completed a battle test in Syria and is now beginning to equip a number of units for further testing, National Interest quoted Nov. 1, 2019.
Other news about technology tips that cover how to protect personal data from hackers who use Pegasus Spyware.
Here are the three most popular news on the Tekno channel:
1. Not Paying Debt, Founder of Chinese Cellphone Factory is Prohibited from Living Fancy
The founder of the Smartisan brand mobile phone company in China, was prohibited from taking a fast train and aircraft in his own country because his company did not comply with a court decision on contractual matters.
Smartisan's founder, Luo Yonghao, was also barred from staying overnight in luxury hotels, having fun at luxury night clubs, golf clubs, buying property, taking premium insurance and sending children to expensive private schools, according to orders from the Danyang court in southern China, quoted from Reuters.
The court issued the order because Smartisan failed to fulfill the court's decision regarding a contract dispute with the local electronics company.
2. Russian Orion Combat Drone Tested in War in Syria
Russia's drone or drone Orion has completed a battle test in Syria and is now beginning to equip a number of units for further testing, National Interest quoted Nov. 1, 2019.
Orion is a satellite-controlled weapon, a product of the Kronshtadt Group. This drone is similar to the predator aircraft of the US Air Force Reaper, which retired in 2017 after being used for more than 20 years.
"The Orion drone in its attack configuration can carry up to four missiles, which were successfully tested in Syria," an anonymous source told Russian news agency TASS. "Drones began to be used by Russian forces for operational evaluations, after which the command will make production decisions."
3. Technology Tips: Protect Privacy Data from Pegasus Spyware
This technology tips Tempo reviewed how to protect personal data from hackers who use Pegasus Spyware.
Within a week, two cases of data theft were revealed. First, is the sale of Indian debit and credit card details on the dark web. Second, is the use of Pegasus Spyware to spy on human rights activists and journalists.
In addition to the three most popular news stories above, you can read today's news about science and technology only on the Tekno Tempo.co channel.
